instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.003a draw liquid damage
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged. getting 5v on usb c

getting 3.<SIGNAL>3_G3H</SIGNAL>

changed all c00 ics all 4, changed isl chip
 <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> pin 10 is 5v

<DIODE>D6902</DIODE> pin 1 and 3 5v and pin 2 0.5v so lost on this one

if and when pretty has charge will turn on and right fan will spin real loud 

thoughts TIA

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.003a draw liquid damage
threads.message:
More dificil to diagnose after you changed many things.
You must always measure something, before change components.

Did you solder exactly same code (C00) for all USB-C controllers?
Are you sure all have been perfectly soldered?
If only one doesn't work correctly, SMC will not allow charger function.

If machine starts when battery has some charge, means there is no problem on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, nor 3V42 powe rails.
And of course all secondary power supplies work.
You can have temperature sensor problem, or maybe trackpad not connected in that test.

You main problem is before <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> I suppose.
Or it gets blocked from some reason.
Check all LDO outputs from <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips; voltage and resistance to ground (diode mode).
Also check <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> (with charger only).
